brewery.brewery_description:
In 1981, Redhook founders, Gordon Bowker and Paul Shipman, had a revolutionary vision that all beer drinkers deserved something different than the flavorless lagers or stale imports that were available at the time. Using second-hand and makeshift equipment they opened the Redhook Ale Brewery inside a renovated transmission shop in Ballard, Seattle.

Four decades later and the beer scene, just like our hometown of Seattle, looks very different. And though a lot has changed, we are still driven by our founder's original vision to make well-crafted, approachable beers for the people. Over the years the recipes may have changed, but the spirit of entrepreneurship and work-ethic still underlies everything we do in our pursuit of making the hardest-working beer in the fridge.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

beer.beer_description:
In 1981, Redhook Brewery was born in a converted transmission shop in Ballard, Seattle. Back in those days, building a brewery from the ground up was no easy task, but the delicious beer at the end of the journey made the long hours all worth it. Hazy Big Ballard is bold and juicy, yet has a soft body, complimented by citrus and tropical flavors from Sabro, El Dorado, Bru-1 and Cascade hops, that linger on the finish. 

Whatever you’re building, Hazy Big Ballard is the perfect way to cap off a long day and give you the reward you have earned. Cheers from the founders and from The Captain.

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 105 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 22!

beer.beer_description: In 1982 Redhook was born in a converted transmission shop in the Ballard District outside of Seattle, WA. After 28 years of brewing, Redhook is paying homage to its roots by releasing Big Ballard Imperial IPA. Big Ballard has a rich, deep golden and a very assertive hop character that hits you in the nose before reaching your lips. The flavor and aroma are balanced with complex malty undertones. While it has a friendly side, make no mistake - Big Ballard is brewed for diehard IPA fans. Big Ballard pairs well with sausage, cured meats with ground mustard, spicy Mexican or Asian dishes, and barbeque. Available in the Western US year round in both 22 ounce bottles and on draught.

items.badge_description: Load up those hops, watch the IBU grow and drink it down! Now you’re all hopped up. The more bitter, the better. That's 85 different beers with an IBU of 65 or higher. Try 5 more for Level 18!

Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 120 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 25! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: Tropical Big Ballard is a big beer with big IPA flavors to live up to the name, but with a bit of a softer touch. Brewed with mouthwatering natural Orange, Pineapple, Starfruit & Coconut, this IPA puts you at ease with every sip, as if you were on a beach in a tropical destination. Perhaps Aruba? Jamaica? Ohh I want to take you to Bermuda, Bahama, come on Captain Ballard! We’ll get there fast and take it slow! That’s where we want to go. To that place in the garage where we go to get away from it all. All aboard!

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 270 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 55. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

Oak Aged Ale brewed with Honey
Hand crafted by 8 brewers working in 4 teams, this Imperial Brown Ale was developed from their individual recipes carefully blended into one distinctive ale. Rich and flavorful, brewed with cherry-wood smoked malts and brown sugar.

items.badge_description: Dating back to the 17th century, Brown Ales come in a number of varieties. With malty, nutty characteristics and a smooth finish, it's sure to cure your cravings. That's 210 different Brown Ales. Try 5 more for 43.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 465 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 94!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 10 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: Named in honor of our industrious predecessors whose hard work helped make Seattle such an incredible city. Long Hammer IPA is brewed to deliver a piney and citrusy hop aroma. It’s a classic West Coast-style India Pale Ale and one of America’s most drinkable IPAs.

In 1982 Redhook was born in a converted transmission shop in the Ballard District outside of Seattle, WA. After 28 years of brewing, Redhook is paying homage to its roots by releasing Big Ballard Imperial IPA. Big Ballard has a rich, deep golden and a very assertive hop character that hits you in the nose before reaching your lips. The flavor and aroma are balanced with complex malty undertones. While it has a friendly side, make no mistake - Big Ballard is brewed for diehard IPA fans. Big Ballard pairs well with sausage, cured meats with ground mustard, spicy Mexican or Asian dishes, and barbeque. Available in the Western US year round in both 22 ounce bottles and on draught.

beer.beer_description: Named in honor of our industrious predecessors whose hard work helped make Seattle such an incredible city. Long Hammer IPA is brewed to deliver a piney and citrusy hop aroma. It’s a classic West Coast-style India Pale Ale and one of America’s most drinkable IPAs.

The beer that started it all, Redhook ESB has been continuously brewed since 1987. True to the British ESB style, the beer is not extra bitter, despite having the words in its name. Instead, ESB balances caramel malt sweetness and subtle spicy and citrusy hop flavors.

Winterhook is Redhook’s legendary winter ale, brewed annually since 1984. Crafted with an evolving mix of malts and hops, each yearly edition of Winterhook is one-of-a-kind. Winterhook’s dark colors and bold flavors make it a perfect winter warmer for frosty weather.

In 1982 Redhook was born in a converted transmission shop in the Ballard District outside of Seattle, WA. After 28 years of brewing, Redhook is paying homage to its roots by releasing Big Ballard Imperial IPA. Big Ballard has a rich, deep golden and a very assertive hop character that hits you in the nose before reaching your lips. The flavor and aroma are balanced with complex malty undertones. While it has a friendly side, make no mistake - Big Ballard is brewed for diehard IPA fans. Big Ballard pairs well with sausage, cured meats with ground mustard, spicy Mexican or Asian dishes, and barbeque. Available in the Western US year round in both 22 ounce bottles and on draught.

Peaches for Me is an IPA that gets a big fruity punch of Peach and Mango. Inspired by he citrusy and peachy Citra, and the brazen Bravo, this IPA gets a boost of fresh fruit flavor from peach and mango purees along with peach concentrate. Upfront peach and hop aroma give way to a smooth finish with hints of tropical mango and a touch of malt sweetness from the honey malt

The waves are turbulent and unrelenting. Such is life sometimes, but don’t despair. Whatever the storm surge brings your way, you got this! Treat yourself to a Storm Surge Hazy IPA and take a break from the rough seas. It's what we call "a PNW Hazy". Brewed with the body of an east-coast hazy, and with Galaxy and Mosaic to give the tropical flavors, but also with Lemondrop and Cascade to add a bit of west-coast IPA bite. So grab one and stand at ease, you’ve earned it, sailor!

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description:
In 1981, Redhook Brewery was born in a converted transmission shop in Ballard, Seattle. Back in those days, building a brewery from the ground up was no easy task, but the delicious beer at the end of the journey made the long hours all worth it. Hazy Big Ballard is bold and juicy, yet has a soft body, complimented by citrus and tropical flavors from Sabro, El Dorado, Bru-1 and Cascade hops, that linger on the finish. 

Whatever you’re building, Hazy Big Ballard is the perfect way to cap off a long day and give you the reward you have earned. Cheers from the founders and from The Captain.

Tropical Big Ballard is a big beer with big IPA flavors to live up to the name, but with a bit of a softer touch. Brewed with mouthwatering natural Orange, Pineapple, Starfruit & Coconut, this IPA puts you at ease with every sip, as if you were on a beach in a tropical destination. Perhaps Aruba? Jamaica? Ohh I want to take you to Bermuda, Bahama, come on Captain Ballard! We’ll get there fast and take it slow! That’s where we want to go. To that place in the garage where we go to get away from it all. All aboard!

Lagersquatch prowls the Pacific Northwest in search of good times and friends to share beer. Always in his handcrafted mug is the beer that bears his name – a crisp and straightforward, yet flavorful and refreshing lager, born of the Pacific Northwest. It's the classic lawn-mowing lager, but with just a little bit of a hop kick. If he finds you, and hope that the does, there’s no need to run. Lagersquatch is your friend, and he’s here to party.
It’s time to fight to save day and be the Real American Hero. Brewed with Skagit Valley Malting’s Copeland and Dark Munich for a rich malt backbone for the Citra, Amarillo and Chinook bomb.

Guava and mango milkshake IPA finished with Mexican Vanilla Beans. Heavy hand of Ella hop from Australia combine with Mosaic , Azacca and a touch of Idaho 7 for a tropical medley of hop goodness. Pilsner, Wheat Malt and Flaked Wheat with lactose milksugar for a light colored full bodied IPA.
Hoppy German Amber ale featuring Spalter Select hops.  The name harkens back to our autoshop roots at Pike Motorworks.
Marrying the hops from across the ditch, Galaxy (AUS) and Wakatu (NZ) highlight this hazy fruit bomb. Pilsner, wheat and flaked oats provide a pillowy backdrop for melon and citrus hop aromas.
Fresh Single Hopped  experimental IPA utilizing hop 431.

Alias of Redhook IPA   

A lighter, drier ale with a warm, brassy color and herbal aroma.
Classic Baltic Porter with a hint of maple syrup
Our Trollyman/s Porter is an oatmeal porter with roasted malty notes and a creamy mouthfeel
Brewed as a double mash with the biggest starting gravity of any beer we've done so far. Aged in freshly dumped Smooth Ambler Kentucky Bourbon Barrels.
We got on the Schwartz bus in Woodinville and road it all the way to Cap Hill. A brewers beer if there ever was one this tasty dark lager is sure to please. This is a collaboration with 20 Corners
Totally different from the standard ESB.  More pine but less malty smooth/creamy mouthfeel on finish
Light lager.  Supports student athletes at University of Washington

Output force is the force exerted on an object by a simple machine, in this case hops, lots of them; Galaxy, Mosaic, HBC-431 and Simcoe. Kiss of Munich and a bunch of pale malt, ad some yeast and boom you got Force Output.
Brewed with Georgetown Brewing Company, this tasty IPA is a new age hop extravagance, made with Lemon drop, Azacca and Galaxy hops.

Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten. This hear is the ale to do it with. Skagit Valley Pale and Dark Munich malts lay a rich backbone for copius amounts of simcoe, 431, Galaxy, Citra and Mosaic to do their damage.
